newsitem.title: USA: Calif. agency sells $45 mln bonds for PG&E.
newsitem.headline: Calif. agency sells $45 mln bonds for PG&E.

text.p: California's Pollution Control Financing Authority on Thursday issued $45 million of tax-exempt bonds for PG&E Corp's Pacific Gas and Electric Co, the company said.
The pollution control refunding revenue bonds, 1997 series A, due December 1, 2018, were initially priced at a variable daily interest rate, PG&E said.
Proceeds from the sale will redeem bonds previously issued by the authority. Lead manager for the issue was J.P. Morgan & Co. Co-manager was Samuel A. Ramirez & Co Inc.
